meanings.sent1: I need to fill the glass with water.
meanings.sent2: The bucket will fill up with sand at the beach.
meanings.sent3: Please fill the cup to the brim with juice.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery.

meanings.definition: To occupy or take up space
meanings.sent1: The books fill the shelves in the library.
meanings.sent2: The crowd will fill the stadium for the concert.
meanings.sent3: His loud voice filled the room, drowning out all other sounds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile filled his thoughts, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The colorful balloons filled the sky with brightness.

meanings.definition: To supply with what is lacking
meanings.sent1: She will fill the empty shelves with new books.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will fill the students' minds with knowledge.
meanings.sent3: His jokes always fill the room with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness filled the void in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The warm soup filled their hungry stomachs.

meanings.definition: To satisfy or meet a need
meanings.sent1: Eating a good meal will fill your hunger.
meanings.sent2: A hug can fill the need for comfort.
meanings.sent3: Music has the power to fill the soul with emotions.
meanings.sent4: Her words filled him with confidence before the exam.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful scenery filled her with peace and contentment.

meanings.definition: To complete a form or document by providing required information
meanings.sent1: Please fill in your name and address on the form.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to fill out all the sections of the application.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fill in the missing details on the report.
meanings.sent4: She quickly filled out the survey with her feedback.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to fill in the blanks in the worksheet.
